column1: Persons of Color as a percent of the total population
Twin Cities 7-county region, Greater MN, and Minnesota, 1960-2035
Because Hispanic ethnicity was not asked on the Decennial Census before
1980, Hispanics in 1960 and 1970 may have been classified as either White
Prior to 2000, the Decennial Census allowed individuals to select only one
race, with the result that some multiracial people may have been counted
In 2010 and later, the Census Bureauâ€™s Population Estimates program
reclassified individuals in the "some other race" category into one of
the five standard race categories. This change results in the number "Of
Color" being slightly smaller than it otherwise would have been.
2000 and earlier: U.S. Census Bureau, Decennial Census.
2010 and later: U.S. Census Bureau, Population Estimates.
Forecast: Minnesota State Demographic Center, Minnesota population
projections by race and ethnicity, 2005 to 2035.
